<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Phi instructions will eventually be lowered to copy instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If phi is in a loop header, a recurrence may formulated around the source</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and destination of the phi. For such case commuting operands of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions in the recurrence may enable coalescing of the copy instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><Highlight kind="comment">/// generated from the phi. For example, if there is a recurrence of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LoopHeader:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %1 = phi(%0, %100)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LoopLatch:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %0&lt;def, tied1&gt; = ADD %2&lt;def, tied0&gt;, %1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610"><Highlight kind="comment">/// , the fact that %0 and %2 are in the same tied operands set makes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the coalescing of copy instruction generated from the phi in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LoopHeader(i.e. %1 = COPY %0) impossible, because %1 and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %2 have overlapping live range. This introduces additional move</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction to the final assembly. However, if we commute %2 and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1615"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %1 of ADD instruction, the redundant move instruction can be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1616"><Highlight kind="comment">/// avoided.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PeepholeOptimizer::optimizeRecurrence(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpurewriteundefforphi-cpp/#a2e83cb1bc3f5e8986cbd14575755a134">PHI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1618"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallset">SmallSet&lt;Register, 2&gt;</a> TargetRegs;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1964"><Highlight kind="normal">ValueTrackerResult ValueTracker::getNextSourceFromRegSequence() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1965"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>((<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a10793004faece2bb74d3363b5f6ce96f">Def</a>-&gt;isRegSequence() || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a10793004faece2bb74d3363b5f6ce96f">Def</a>-&gt;isRegSequenceLike()) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1966"><Highlight kind="normal">         </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Invalid definition&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1967"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1968"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a10793004faece2bb74d3363b5f6ce96f">Def</a>-&gt;getOperand(DefIdx).getSubReg())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1969"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we are composing subregs, bail out.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1970"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The case we are checking is Def.&lt;subreg&gt; = REG&#95;SEQUENCE.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1971"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This should almost never happen as the SSA property is tracked at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1972"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the register level (as opposed to the subreg level).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1973"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// I.e.,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1974"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Def.sub0 =</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1975"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Def.sub1 =</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1976"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is a valid SSA representation for Def.sub0 and Def.sub1, but not for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1977"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Def. Thus, it must not be generated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1978"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, some code could theoretically generates a single</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1979"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Def.sub0 (i.e, not defining the other subregs) and we would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1980"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have this case.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1981"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we can ascertain (or force) that this never happens, we could</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1982"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// turn that into an assertion.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1983"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ValueTrackerResult();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1984"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2014"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#ad153312ce0e21a9c411b560bd535b1b7">RegSubRegPairAndIdx</a> InsertedReg;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2015"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>-&gt;getInsertSubregInputs(&#42;Def, DefIdx, BaseReg, InsertedReg))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2018"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We are looking at:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2019"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Def = INSERT&#95;SUBREG v0, v1, sub1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2020"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are two cases:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2021"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 DefSubReg == sub1, get v1.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2022"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 DefSubReg != sub1, the value may be available through v0.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2023"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2026"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ValueTrackerResult(InsertedReg.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetinstrinfo/regsubregpair/#aad7e848e562b1368d6ee4794d84957c6">Reg</a>, InsertedReg.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetinstrinfo/regsubregpair/#a66f92cf2247d7b3c3a351ff48dd42d7d">SubReg</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2027"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2028"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// #2 Otherwise, if the sub register we are looking for is not partial</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2029"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// defined by the inserted element, we can look through the main</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2030"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register (v0).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2031"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp;MODef = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a10793004faece2bb74d3363b5f6ce96f">Def</a>-&gt;getOperand(DefIdx);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2032"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the result register (Def) and the base register (v0) do not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
